185446958.review: Fun game that you can leave and come back to easily.

185415175.review:
This game seems like it is underappreciated.
I bought it and proceeded to play 10 hours straight, forgetting everything else around me. Awesome work from the devs. There are so many features in the game that you can easily miss them.

The only thing I dislike is that the UI can sometimes feel convoluted. I'm starting to internalise many of the menus though, so this problem is going away by itself. Again, great game, highly recommend.

185361975.review:
Ironically, given its subject matter, Software Inc has fallen to massive feature creep. Everything you could possibly imagine about running a computing company, from server management to stock trading, is modelled. You might find that fun, but there's simply too much going on for me.

If you're going to have that level of complexity, you need good tutorials - pop up boxes telling you what to click, without telling you *why*, aren't good tutorials. This game has been in early access since 2015 - ten years later, I fear the dev may have lost track on what the new player experience is like. It's not good enough.

There definitely is great potential, but the overcomplication needs to be addressed.

184792541.review:
Good game, I remember buying it like 5 years ago on a sale and not even playing it... I came back to it last year (2024) and played with a friend and had a blast. 

The more I play the more I learn even after 100 hours I have a lot left to learn and do. One of the good things of the game is the amount of choices you have in front of you. Even after 100 hours I have yet to produce my own console or product, I have just started to manufacture my own products etc. 

I recommend the game if you are a fan of the tycoons games definitively a unique game.

183869973.review: This game is beautiful, you get exactly what you expect and more. Countless mods that provide positives to the game, fun multiplayer experiences and more. This game is a master piece and is continuously getting updates, that provide meaning and benefit the game. Never encountered a bug in the game and whilst running mods. You get to build software, create your own platforms, large control over decisions and good AI. This game has it all and should have more attention for what it is. You can get stuck playing this game for hours and I'm sure the development team for this game has even more installed for us.

183738921.review:
Genail!

Ich hatte es schon einige Jahre auf der Wunschliste, nur nie gekauft weil Deutsch nicht vorhanden war.
Dank einiger Youtuber gesehen das sie es aber auf Deutsch spielen und mir nen Mod-Übersetzer runtergeladen.

Am Anfang echt überfordert, aber nach paar versuchen und Lesen statt nur klicken & passt. Klappt es bestens.
Neben MG2 & ML ist Software Inc. einer meiner kleinen Highlights diesen Jahres. 
Bitte weiter so!
Big Thx. :)

183666847.review: This is an amazing game, and I've been enjoying it for years! The gameplay is incredibly engaging, and I love the depth it offers. One area I'd love to see expanded in future updates is the employee management/HR system. It would be fantastic to have a more robust feature that allows for promotions, with each new role introducing additional elements, responsibilities, and tasks specific to that position. A fully developed "climb the ladder" career progression for team members would add even more depth to the game. Overall, great job on creating such an enjoyable experience! Keep up the excellent work!

183631574.review:
10/10 game. Very amazing have lived many lives:
-Tax evasion Company that hid millions in gold and silver from the government,
-Cheap Chinese Rip off Manufacturing company making console controllers for other company's consoles,
-Making Millions in a garage having bought subsidiary companies that make me money,
-Becoming a monopoly that owns the game you want to play, the engine you want to play it on, the console you have to play it on, and the controller you have to use.
-Royalty Baron, owning every yearly technology patent making hundreds of millions a month,
-Owning and maintaining all the servers that every software runs on and having some thieves steal them all and shutting down the entire ingame market services.
-Evil Company that spends its money shutting down random businesses for no reason with ddos attacks,
-Becoming the market's choice for programming languages (modded) and come out with a $60 new programming language every 2 months and shutting down support for older ones.
-Making my own company building, ingnoring fire safety and the inspector yelling at me for me to have the building burn down the next month.
-And of course, LOTS AND LOTS AND LOTS AND LOTS of contract work to get me to these points lol

Only thing I don't necessarily like about the game is just the Hardware aspect. Don't get me wrong its just as complex and cool as everything else in the game but personally it takes too long and too much money for me to make a good factory, by that point I've already got a cool story for the company I am playing and don't want to deviate away for the sake of making my own products in house.

183582481.review: Deeply Addicting once you pass the learning curve of youtube videos

183556619.review:
Wow this game is bad! No sequel, and since i have 30 hours of software development experience i know that this is very bad for business. They must be doing contract work. 

Now the real review. Fun game, early game is pretty hard (making your own games) or boring (spamming contract work) depending on how you play it. Later on you just make a lot of money which gives you loads of time to fully develop your next product. But don't worry there are 1001 things to develop (and make losses on :D ) with software, hardware and printing.
